Topic.Title: What I found out during a simple dinner about Tumblr......

Message.Msg: I didn't hear anything bad about this YHOO-Tumblr deal from GS, BAC, MS, Stifel, C, Barclays, Gabelli, Cantor F, Oppenheimer, Credit S, to name a few . These are not unknown or little investment houses. It is very interesting they didn't not disagree with this deal so it means they approved and liked it.

Message.Title: Tumblr generates $13 million in revenues?
Message.Msg: 3) About the Yahoo deal for Tumblr: I do get it: the tech giant is trying to buy younger eyeballs. Still, Tumblr offers 100 million blogs, and 36 million unique visitors in the U.S., 117 million worldwide? That comes out to one person per blog, which is a strange metric. And the price tag is questionable: $1.1 billion? Seems like an awful lot of money to me.

Topic.Title: Porn

Message.Msg: I like flickr because it screens out the porn unless you log in and allow it. Also flickr member can easily block other flickr member who's favorate photos of other members are all porn. Unfortunately Yahoo destoryed flicker. I think millions of flickr member uploaded pictures every day and had contact with hundreds of flickr friends - unfortunately that is gone if you are using IE.

Topic.Title: It is a joke, that Tumbrl has the 27-fold price and Yelp the 50-fold market-cap of Local Corp, but both less US-Monthly-Unique-Visitors (newest numbers from Siteanalytics)

Message.Msg: Big Progress on the Way to 50/50 in 2013: Organic Traffic and Direct Revenues produce no cost of revenues Development of Organic Traffic/Monthly Unique Visitors (MUVs): 2010: 88 million = 31% of total traffic 2011: 117 million = 33% of total traffic 2012: 155 million = 37% of total traffic Q1/2013: 48% of total traffic Goal: 50% of total traffic "The change in policy in 2013 is an important step to build a more defensible and sustanainable business to growing organic traffic and organic revenues. We have taken decisive cost-cutting measures to return the company to cash flow positive, and expect steady revenue growth and margin improvement throughout 2013. While there are periodic challenges when working in a competitive, dynamic and high growth sector, these challenges often create new opportunities for future growth. We are confident that we are well positioned to capitalize on those opportunities with a powerful platform and an experienced team.”

Message.Title: Should flickr members sue?
Message.Msg: Both flickr members and advertisors are devistated by the tsunomi that changed or destroyed flickr a few days ago. Some flickr members uploaded pictures everyday. They had daily contacts with many of their hundreds of flickr friends. Some kept person photo journals for photo therapy. Now since the changes, flickr isn't accessable with some devices such as a computer with IE. flickr ads can't be seen. When the 'changed' flickr was working a few days ago, I noticed that flickr members' photostream index pages didn't have any room for ads. When viewing individual pictures, the picture is now so big that there is no room for an ad to the right of the picture. That is if your computer or device can handle the bandwidth needed to view the now huge web pages. Flickr used to have ads next to the photo, and you could right click to view the original picture.

Topic.Title: It is a joke, that Tumbrl has the 27-fold price and Yelp the 50-fold market-cap of Local Corp, but both less US-Monthly-Unique-Visitors (newest numbers from Siteanalytics)

Message.Msg: Ignore lies and nonsense of lutts: Company reports positive cash flow from operations Local Corporation Reports First Quarter 2013 Financial Results Company reports positive cash flow from operations one quarter earlier than forecasted Local Corporation – Thu, May 9, 2013 4:15 PM EDT Local Corporation (LOCM), a leading online local media company, today reported its financial results for the first quarter 2013. “As previously announced, we achieved positive cash flow from operations a quarter ahead of schedule, due to solid gross margin expansion in the first quarter. We remain on track to grow our revenues sequentially while keeping operating expenses about flat, resulting in projected sequential adjusted EBITDA and EPS growth,” said Heath Clarke, Local Corporation chairman and CEO. “We completed a small financing in order to strengthen our cash position so that we can focus on specific growth opportunities within our Network business. Overall, we believe our combination of intellectual property, experience and know-how, leave us well-positioned to thrive in local search as well as capitalize on the rapidly emerging mobile local search ecosystem.” • Revenue – First quarter 2013 revenue of $21.8 million represents an increase of 4 percent over fourth quarter 2012 revenue of $20.9 million and a 13 percent decrease over first quarter 2012 revenues of $25.0 million. • Adjusted EBITDA – The company reported positive Adjusted EBITDA for the first quarter 2013 of $605,000, or $0.03 per diluted share, as compared to fourth quarter 2012 negative Adjusted EBITDA of ($924,000), or ($0.04) per diluted share.

Topic.Title: What I found out during a simple dinner about Tumblr......

Message.Msg: I heard the exact same thing about Facebook, kids no longer like it and most of the resin is because they're bored with it and thier parents use it. However i did not hear the same about tumblr. Of course when asked what the parent i was talking to about this what she thought about tumblr, she didn't know what it was.

Topic.Title: What I found out during a simple dinner about Tumblr......

Message.Msg: IDK about "every HS kid" cause my nieces and nephews don't which covers middle school and HS. They use Twitter, Instagram and Facebook. The big thing now are these very short video sites(few seconds to 36 seconds) in Vine and Keek. As for "trained by Google"...big whup as that is no guarantee of success. Ron Johnson was "trained at Apple" by Jobs himself and look what he did to JC Penneys. Elop was "trained at MSFT" and he hasn't did anything at Nokia in the past 2yrs. Now if you say "trained at GE" then you'd be onto something cause for DECADES they were a feeding ground for future CEO's of other Fortune 500 companies. The HS kids grow up like crazy in those 4yrs and move on completely when college rolls around and its night and day between when they get their 1st career job. Think of the boy bands of the late 90's...HUGE from 98-2002 and then the teenyboppers grew up. Look at clothing stores tailored to teens...Abercrombie, RU21, GAP, I'm drawing a blank on a few others but their earnings fluctuate like crazy getting that group to buy. Whether Marissa does everything PERFECTLY to pull this off...hope so but I'm still against it from a risk/reward standpoint. Anyone can be a sucker for hype but not everyone gets down to brass tacks as they say.

Topic.Title: What I found out during a simple dinner about Tumblr......

Message.Msg: For all us older investors (non H.S. age) I urge you to ask your teen kids for their opinion. ; This will open eyes......I'm sure MM has a grand plan to monetize. Don't focus on "they are just making $13MM per year thought." Instead....think about how Google monetized You Tube. Did people leave You Tube? NO. Don't let the experts scare you....again, ask you kids! BTW....I ask all my collegues if they use Tumbler. Most of them are late 20's to 40's. They said no. I said to myself....goood!!! That is NOT the audience MM is going after. LOL

Message.Title: Bloomberg's article on Yahoo's big mistake...
Message.Msg: There was not "big mistake" - this article is missing the boat. Excerpted from Bloomberg: "The one bright spot was its 40 percent stake in China's largest e-commerce company, Alibaba Group Holdings Ltd. In 2012, however, Yahoo agreed to sell back half its stock in a company that dominates a high-growth market in the world's fastest-growing region. The deal, which Yahoo's board approved unanimously, was worth $7 billion, of which Yahoo netted $3.65 billion after taxes and buybacks. This week, Yahoo used a chunk of that cash to buy Tumblr. " ***** Sure, except over 70% of Alibaba was owned by outsiders - there would be no discussion of AG going public without a good chunk of that going back to AG. Sure, except Yang snagged that stake for $1billion & last year when the stock was languishing, everyone and their Uncle was screaming for Yahoo to monetize a significant portion of the AG stake. Sure, they paid 1.1Billion for Tumblr but, as was mentioned in an article this week, by Eric Jackson I believe, AG has redeemed the preferred shares Yahoo held - so another way to view it is that they applied this cash to the Tumblr purchase - & barely touched the cash on hand. Sure, whatever you say...

Topic.Title: KKR & Silver Lake rumored to have joined bidding for Hulu.

Message.Msg: The original release was from Reuters. Here is a late story from ATD. Add one more name to Hulu bidding derby: Yahoo, which just announced plans to buy Tumblr for $1.1 billion, has made an offer on the video Web site as well. The Web giant submitted a bid for the video site this morning, according to a person familiar with process. Other people looking to buy all or a piece of Hulu include: •Directv, •Time Warner Cable •William Morris Endeavor, along with with PE backer Silverlake •KKR •Guggenheim Digital •The Chernin Group As All Things Digital reported earlier this month, Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer and COO Henrique De Castro have met with Hulu’s team recently for a get-to-know-you; Yahoo had previously tried to buy a large stake in French video site DailyMotion, but that bid was stymied by the French government. Yahoo declined to comment. More shortly.

Message.Title: Yahoo Said to Make Offer for Hulu as Bidding Escalates
Message.Msg: Yahoo! submitted an offer for Hulu LLC, the online video site, according to a person with knowledge of the situation, expanding the number of suitors for the service to at least seven. Other bidders include KKR & Co., DirecTV (DTV), Time Warner Cable Inc., Guggenheim Digital, the Chernin Group LLC and a joint offer from Silver Lake Management LLC and talent agency William Morris Endeavor Entertainment LLC, people with knowledge of the situation said.

Topic.Title: Yahoo's Transformation Into A Growth Stock Accelerates

Message.Msg: I think MM's biggest challenge is to retain the super talent she's accumulated around her with the recent acquisitions. Part of the reason why these upstarts succeeded is because the brains were 'big fish in little ponds,' and their talent was recognized, appreciated and rewarded. Now, as a part of the HUGE (and growing) YAHOO!, they may feel their voices aren't heard, and they are becoming just another number. Dissatisfied, unappreciated workers leave. Retaining these brainiacs will be a big challenge for MM and her managers. I hope they succeed!

Message.Msg: 300%??? The stock DIPPED to $8.96 for less than a week before it was right back to the $11-$12 range. They've also bought back 260,000,000 shares in that time which in actuality makes this $20/$21 back then. A double or so! As for Hulu, it'd be cool as I've recommended video(Netflix) for 4.5yrs now so a feather in my cap but its been rumored that Yahoo is going to buy it for 3/3.5yrs now. It's gotten a lot better in the last year alone, I've used it a few times. Amazon's Prime could be the one to catch Netflix IMO. MSFT too is launching a service on its XBOX One that will go after Netflix. Winner in all of this is the consumer...loser potentially the investor.

Topic.Title: YHOO & AAPL join to Buy HULU?

Message.Msg: It's no big secret that Yahoo is in communications with Apple, but not for a buyout, more of a strategic planning. Yahoo will not get outbid by anyone for anything they set their sites on at this stage. Ms. Marissa Mayer will not, cannot, and should not be stopped at this point. Big things will happen soon, and then skyrocket when Microsoft's ball and chain is cut loose.
